neurotools.stats.convolutional.blockccm(k, spikes)[source]¶

TODO: documentation

Generate covariance matrix for linear least squares. It is a block matrix of all pairwise cross-correlation matrices NTrials,NNeurons,NSamples = np.shape(spikes)

neurotools.stats.convolutional.sta(i, spikes, lfp)[source]¶

Construct size k STA NTrials,NNeurons,NSamples = np.shape(spikes)

neurotools.stats.convolutional.blocksta(k, spikes, lfp)[source]¶

TODO: documentation

Block spike-triggered average vector for time-domain least squares filter NTrials,NNeurons,NSamples = np.shape(spikes)

neurotools.stats.convolutional.cspect(i, j, spikes)[source]¶

Get cross-spectral density as FT of cross-correlation

neurotools.stats.convolutional.cspectm(spikes)[source]¶

TODO: documentation

Get all pairs cross spectral matrix NTrials,NNeurons,NSamples = np.shape(spikes) This is doing much more work than is needed, should change it to frequency domain.

TODO: documentation

Cross-spectral densities between spikes and LFP NTrials,NNeurons,NSamples = np.shape(spikes)

neurotools.stats.convolutional.spectreconstruct(k, B, spikes=None, fftspikes=None)[source]¶

TODO: documentation

Reconstructs LFP from spikes using cross-spectral matrix. Can optionally pass the fts if they are already available NTrials,NNeurons,NSamples = np.shape(spikes)

neurotools.stats.convolutional.construct_lowpass_operator(fb, k, Fs=1000.0)[source]¶

TODO: documentation

Constructs a low-pass regularization operator Get the impulse response of a low-pass filter first Then copy it into the matrix. This really only makes sense in the time domain.

neurotools.stats.convolutional.autocorrelation_bayes(s, D=200, prior_var=None)[source]¶

Computes autocorrelation of signal s over time lags D, applying a Gaussian prior of mean zero and variance prior_var. If prior_var is None, then the length of signal s is used.

Parameters:
  • s (sequence of values) –
  • D (number of lags to compute, default is 200) –
  • prior_var (positive scalar or None, default is None) –
Returns:

xc
Return type:

autocorrelation over lags D, with zero-lag variance
